title.narrative: Scaling up prevention efforts towards the elimination of cholera in Haiti through the implementation of an oral cholera vaccination campaign

description.narrative:
UNICEF and WHO propose to carry out a cholera vaccination campaign for 200,000 people. The campaign is the second phase in a multi-year campaign and the remaining 300,000 people to be vaccinated will be targeted through a third campaign planned for 2015. In particular, UNICEF and WHO propose to give two doses of the oral Shanchol vaccine per person to people over one year of age (except pregnant women) in areas with 1) high cholera incidence rate, 2) high population density and 3) limited access to water and sanitation. The agencies also plan to train 150 community health workers to carry out the campaign.
Total project budget: US$2,741,445 Total funds received to date: US$0 Amount requested from the CERF: US$990,820
Recommendation: The ERC has agreed to fund the cholera vaccination through CERF on an exceptional basis.
